author: samwilsn
content: Yep, exactly. You can see all the forks, and the changes between them, here: https://ethereum.github.io/execution-specs/py-hardforks.html

author: chfast
content: Lists (e.g. transaction list) are merkalized with variadic length keys. Keys are `RLP(index)`.  MTP falls apart if one key is a prefix of another. In this case RLP gives protection.

author: chfast
content: Also the extension node is unnecessary complication. Extension node always leads to a branch node so you can implement it as a branch node with extension path (single node).
